intro: Hesperis heterophylla, commonly known as the variable hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are variable in shape, ranging from basal rosettes to linear forms, which contributes to its common name. Hesperis heterophylla is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
